abstract: The cable fee fight of the week, between AT&T and Rainbow Media, ended on Thursday with a new deal.
snippet: The cable fee fight of the week, between AT&T and Rainbow Media, ended on Thursday with a new deal.
lead_paragraph: The cable fee fight of the week, between AT&T and Rainbow Media, ended on Thursday with a new deal between the companies.

headline.main: AT&T and Rainbow Reach Cable Deal

abstract: Averting a standoff over programming fees, AT&T said on Thursday it has reached a deal to keep channels AMC, IFC and WE tv on the tube for its 2.3 million U-verse TV subscribers, The Associated Press reported.
snippet: Averting a standoff over programming fees, AT&T said on Thursday it has reached a deal to keep channels AMC, IFC and WE tv on the tube for its 2.3 million U-verse TV subscribers, The Associated Press reported.
lead_paragraph: Averting a standoff over programming fees, AT&T said on Thursday it has reached a deal to keep channels AMC, IFC and WE tv on the tube for its 2.3 million U-verse TV subscribers, The Associated Press reported.

headline.main: AT&T U-Verse Reaches Deal to Keep AMC,’ Mad Men’

abstract: President Obama’s legislative success, as with the passage of the financial regulatory overhaul on Thursday, poses a paradox: while he may be winning on Capitol Hill, he is losing with voters at a time of economic distress and soon may be forced to scale back his ambitions.
snippet: President Obama’s legislative success, as with the passage of the financial regulatory overhaul on Thursday, poses a paradox: while he may be winning on Capitol Hill, he is losing with voters at a time of economic distress and soon may be forced t...
lead_paragraph: If passage of the financial regulatory overhaul on Thursday proves anything about President Obama, it is this: He knows how to push big bills through a balky Congress.

headline.main: Obama Pushes Through Agenda Despite Political Risks

abstract: While Bank of America’s chief executive struck an upbeat tone on Friday, he cautioned that some elements in the economy may continue to negatively affect the firm.
snippet: While Bank of America’s chief executive struck an upbeat tone on Friday, he cautioned that some elements in the economy may continue to negatively affect the firm.
lead_paragraph: 9:24 a.m. | Updated While Bank of America‘s second-quarter results beat analysts’ estimates, investors appeared to be more pessimistic about what the prospects of the firm in a more uncertain economic environment.

headline.main: Bank of America’s Chief Sounds Cautious Note

abstract: Bank of America took more than a few analysts and investors by surprise on Friday by disclosing that the pending financial regulatory overhaul may cost the firm $10 billion or more.
snippet: Bank of America took more than a few analysts and investors by surprise on Friday by disclosing that the pending financial regulatory overhaul may cost the firm $10 billion or more.
lead_paragraph: Bank of America took more than a few analysts and investors by surprise on its earnings call Friday by disclosing that the pending financial regulatory overhaul may cost the firm $10 billion or more.

headline.main: New Card Rules May Cost BofA Billions in Revenue
